brewery.brewery_description: Cheddar Ales began its artisan brewing activities in October 2006 and is based at Winchester Farm on the edge of Cheddar village, near the famous Cheddar Gorge.

beer.beer_description:
A modern classic.
 
Award-winning golden ale with zesty fruit flavours and a rounded, hoppy finish. By far the best selling beer at Cheddar Ales.
 
Brewed using the highest quality Pale ale, Maris Otter, Wheat and Crystal malts and hopped with a blend of English Challenger and Slovenian Styrian Goldings whole hops.
 
Cask 4.3%, Bottle 4.5%

items.checkin_comment: OK, a bit disappointing though, couldn't taste the port

beer.beer_description:
Brewed using the highest quality Pale Ale, Maris Otter, Chocolate, Crystal and Roasted Malts and hopped with a blend of English Northdown and Goldings whole hops.

Available as a seasonal in November and December.

ABV 4.5% (Bottle 4.7%)

items.badge_description: Porters and Stouts are rich with both history and flavor. Roasty, dark, and delicious, these two styles helped start it all. Thatâ€™s 20 different beers with the style of Porter or Stout. Try 5 more for Level 5!

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 300 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 61!

beer.beer_description:
Cask: 4.5%
Bottle: 4.7%

Wild Thing West Coast Pale Ale is crafted using the finest  malted barley with a blend of American Simcoe, Ahtanum and Summit whole hops. An old American Pale Ale, rich, woody, piney and very fresh. Wild Thing you make my heart sing.

items.checkin_comment: Very smooth and malty. Perhaps some festive tones after

beer.beer_description:
A modern classic.
 
Award-winning golden ale with zesty fruit flavours and a rounded, hoppy finish. By far the best selling beer at Cheddar Ales.
 
Brewed using the highest quality Pale ale, Maris Otter, Wheat and Crystal malts and hopped with a blend of English Challenger and Slovenian Styrian Goldings whole hops.
 
Cask 4.3%, Bottle 4.5%
A deep tasting bottle conditioned IPA. Easy to drink, so be careful!

Cask: 4.5%
Bottle: 4.7%

Bitter Bully is a New World style Pale Ale with a big citrusy hop character and thirst quenching finish. Brewed issuing the finest Pale Ale malts with a blend of American Cascade, Amarillo and Simcoe whole hops. You canâ€™t beat a Bitter Bully!

ABV 3.8% (Bottle 4.0%)
Brewed to celebrate the momentous UK summer of 2012, it is a blend of English pale ale with crystal and cara malts, and 4 different hops. Medium bodied with a hint of sweetness.
Light gold very hoppy Pale Ale with spicy, herbal notes and a floral, citrus finish. Simply Rockhard.

Brewed using the highest quality Pale Ale, Maris Otter, Chocolate, Crystal and Roasted Malts and hopped with a blend of English Northdown and Goldings whole hops.

Available as a seasonal in November and December.

ABV 4.5% (Bottle 4.7%)
Chocolate oatmeal stout
KÃ¶lsch pale ale

Wild Thing West Coast Pale Ale is crafted using the finest  malted barley with a blend of American Simcoe, Ahtanum and Summit whole hops. An old American Pale Ale, rich, woody, piney and very fresh. Wild Thing you make my heart sing.
Brewed using Vienna, Cara, Crystal, Wheat malts. Hopped with Centennial, Amarillo, Mosaic, Mandarina Bavaria. Sweet malt background with huge citrus orange hop infusion.
Lisa likes nelson is brewed using the finest bohemian pilsner malt and hopped with simply wonderful nelson sauvin hops
Ripe stone and tropical fruit flavours with a spicy kick from the rye balance the strong malt character of this twist on a classic American recipe.
Spicy farmhouse Saison with a slight natural haze from the yeast, fresh zesty fruit and rich warm spice aromas with a kick of lemon, coriander, black pepper and coconut on the palate.

Brimstone 1000 is a ruby red IPA brewed specifically to celebrate our 1000th brew at Cheddar Ales.
Crafted using the finest malted barley it is our hoppiest brew yet made using a blend of the "biggest" US hops available (Colombus, Citra, Chinock, Centennial and Ekuanot) A fiendishly volley of citrus fruit and chewy, pithy bitterness help to balance the rich malt background. Another dammed good beer, repent and enjoy at your leisure.

Brewed using the finest Extra Pale and Cara malts and a delicious blend of Columbus, Citra, Sorachi Ace and Lemondrop hops, it is sure to please with its spiky upfront bitterness and zesty, orangey dry finish and a hint of ripe peaches.

CALL OF THE VOID was brewed to celebrate the 60th anniversary of famous tight rope walker `Papa Rudy`Omankowski traversing Cheddar Gorge with no harness or safety net.

Do you dare challenge your inner â€œRudyâ€?
Red IPA.
